attributes.action: Make an ammendment to the dangerous dogs act 1991 to include a new license
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
You may own a dog categorised as a dangerous dog breed (DD) if you.
a) Own a new special dog license created to help fund "c"
b) attend a dog safety course at the prospective dog owners expense, only then would you be allowed to handle a DD
c) give police access to the "chip" scanners which your vets have, so you can be stopped and checked to ensure your dogs license is up to date and that you, the handler, have passed the course "b"
d)Make an amendment so that only a list of specially licensed kennels or rescue centres can hold  DD
e)Make breeders of DD have to attend an extended version of “b”
f)That breeders must have a license to sell DD
g)Any DD that shows aggressively dominant behaviour may be seized and if a DD actually bites any person then the dog must be immediately removed and be assessed by a DD behaviour expert. the owner and or handler of the dog must then be given a fine with a minimum of £1000 and a maximum of £250,000
